intro: Phelline lucida, commonly known as the bright phelline, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically features lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
